ansDescription.text:
Explanation:

Given:  

In 100m race; when A runs 100, B ran 90

So, ratio of A and B; A: B = 100:90

Given:

B beats C by 5 m i.e. when B runs 100, C ran 95

So, ratio of B and C; B:C = 100:95

AC= ABx BC

So: AC= 10090x 10095= 200171

It means that when A runs 200 m, then C will complete 171m

Or when A runs 100 m, C will complete 85.5 m.

So, difference = 100-85.5 = 14.5m

Answer (4)

title.description: In a 100 m race A beats B by 10 m. B beats C by 5m. By how many meters does A beat C?

ansDescription.text:
Explanation:  

Given difference sum & product of two integers are in proportion 1:3:10

Let x & y be that two integers

‚üπx-y=3(x+y)=10xy  ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶(*)

From options

option (1) ‚üπif x=3,y=9 Then (*) is not satisfied  

Similarly, (2) & (4) are also incorrect.  

So, correct option is (3)

Answer:(3)

title.description: The difference, the sum and the product of two integers are in the proportion 1: 3: 10. The two integers are:

ansDescription.text:
Explanation: (D)

Given:

Ratio of Boys to Girls = 7:3

Total number of student in the class

= 7ùë• + 3ùë•

= 10ùë• (ùêªùëíùëüùëí, ùë• ùëöùë¢ùë†ùë° ùëèùëí ùëéùëõ ùëñùëõùë°ùëíùëîùëíùëü)

= 50 (As only option (D) satisfies above condition)

Hence, the correct option is (D).

title.description:
The ratio of boys to girls in class is 7 to 3. Among the

options below, an acceptable value for the total number

of students in the class is

ansDescription.text:
Explanation: (B)

Given:

In farm ùëÉ,

Number of Hens = 65

Number of Ducks = 91

Number of Goats = 169

In farm ùëÑ,

Total number of Hens, Ducks, and Goats = 416

The ratio of Hens, Ducks and Goats = 5:14:13

Number of Hens = 416 √ó(5/32) = 65

Number of Ducks = 416 √ó(14/32) = 182

Number of Goats = 416 √ó (13/32) = 169

According to the condition given in the question,

New number of Hens = 65 + 65 = 130

New number of Ducks = 91 + 182 = 273

New number of Goats = 169 + 169 = 338

Thus, the new ratio of Hens, Ducks and Goats

= 10:21:26

Hence, the correct option is (B).

title.description:
The number of hens, ducks and goats in farm ùëÉ are 65, 91

and 169, respectively. The total number of hens, ducks

and goats in a nearby farm ùëÑ is 416. The ratio of hens:

Ducks: Goats and goats are sent from farm ùëÑ to farmùëÉ.

The new ratio of Hens: Ducks: Goats in farm ùëÉ is ______

ansDescription.text:
Explanation:  

The ratio of number of students of three classes

= 3ùë•: 13ùë•: 6ùë•

After implementing the given condition,

3ùë• + 18 = 15ùë¶ ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ . (ùëñ)

13ùë• + 18 = 35ùë¶ ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ (ùëñùëñ)

6ùë• + 18 = 21ùë¶ ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ . (ùëñùëñùëñ)

Multiplying equation (i) by 2,

2 √ó 3ùë• + 18 √ó 2 = 15ùë¶ √ó 2

6ùë• + 36 = 30ùë¶ ‚Ä¶ (ùëñùë£)

Subtract equation (iii) from (iv),

6ùë• + 36 = 30ùë¶ ‚àí 6ùë• + 18 = 21ùë¶

= 18 = 9ùë¶

ùë• = 4

The total number students in all the three classes in the

beginning

22ùë• = 22 √ó 4 = 88

Hence, the correct option is (D).

title.description:
The number of students in three classes is in the ratio

3:13:6. If 18 students are added to each class, the ratio

changes to 15:35:21.

The total number of students in all the three classes in the

beginning was

So the ratio of their speeds = 42: 63 = 2: 3

So the length can be written as

By cross multiplication

By division
